授業目的:
One immediate purpose of this individual research (IR) course is to build on what the students have learned individually from their experience of the Group Research course.
From the Instructor perspective, specific purposes of this IR course include:
To guide IR students towards choosing and develop a research topic and / or series of research questions that interest them most.
To guide IR students towards producing and justifying a research design that reflects academic and professional standards appropriate for international Masters-level study.

Note: Students should choose a research topic along with research questions and research objectives that demonstrate a clear relevance to the broad context and scope of their IMC studies and that connect with current and emerging trends in international business and management practice.
到達目標:
Through active participation in this IR module, each student should be more competent and confident when preparing to:
Present and justify a robust and academically / professional valid research design

Deliver a complete individual research report at a standard appropriate for favourable assessment on an international MBA programme
授業の概要・背景:
The final design and delivery of the module will be produced after the instructor has made an initial assessment of the average level of research experience of the participants, including the research proposal they prepared during their studies on the Group Research (GR) module.
Correspondingly, the assessment is individual to each GR student and consists of preparation of a final report examination in the form of a feasible individual research proposal (document) appropriate to international standards for Masters level business and management research
授業方法:
Seven face-to-face group and individual class sessions.
Home study reading assignments (individual and group) with focus on a set textbook accompanied by tailored readings and case studies selected & distributed by the instructor.
